channel.title: The operating system/distrobution of choice
channel.description:
I've been having huge issues with KDE/GNOME (unresolvable, forget it), and I want to install another operating system/distro on my computer.
I've been yearning to try out Gentoo for a while now... I've also been thinking of something along the lines of FreeBSD/OpenBSD (I didn't post this in the Linux section that reason), but both of those seem too much of a hassle customizing. I already have Windows, and I really don't want Vista since my video card is not powerful enough for it (rofl). I might want to try BeOS or something though.
... any suggestions? comments? rants?

item.title: The operating system/distrobution of choice
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

I ended up installing Gentoo with much trouble devoted to getting wireless to work. The Gentoo docs warned me about wireless support, but I ignored the warnings as usual. I finally got it to work after about 36 boots back and forth between Ubuntu/Gentoo.

@ Mopman: Yes, unfortunately Gentoo only offers installation from source - emerge. I wish it wasn’t so, but oh well

Read full topic

item.title: The operating system/distrobution of choice
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Arch offers both binary and source based packages (like FreeBSD) - goes Gentoo? I think last time I tried it it was source only, but I can’t remember

EDIT: Oh, also, Arch’s init stuff is similar to BSD’s too.

Read full topic

item.title: The operating system/distrobution of choice
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Mopman:

(ArchLinux is the most BSD-like of the Linux distributions, in my opinion).

Even more so than gentoo?

Read full topic

item.title: The operating system/distrobution of choice
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

FreeBSD/Arch (ArchLinux is the most BSD-like of the Linux distributions, in my opinion).

Read full topic

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you don’t want to go Kubuntu, try out Sabayon.
